cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast today, curving northeast tonight and Friday, then accelerating northeastward offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or along the North Carolina coast (Outer Banks vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard MA
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA, Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Georgia through the Carolinas, then the Mid-Atlantic coast and offshore waters to New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts up to 30–40 mph possible Friday evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay, but significant surge (>3 ft) is not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Baltimore area Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches; brief marine squalls possible in lower Chesapeake Bay
